DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Ophthalmologist Confirmed Dry Eye Syndrome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not Keratoconjunctivitis sicca (Dry Eye Syndrome) was confirmed by an ophthalmologist.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Ophthalmologist Confirmation Dry Eye Syndrome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye problems, including injury and disease._Having been established or verified._A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye problems, including injury and disease.:Having been established or verified.:A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.

Concepts.definition: A physician with a Doctor of Medicine or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree (or analogous) who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye disorders, including more complex disorders that require surgery.

A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NIH Score CRF as requested by Y. Yakovlev. mc 11/20/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
